overview: This subject will examine current topics in the discipline of environmental science. The choice of topics will be driven by the students in the subject under the direction of the subject coordinators. Students will organise, lead and participate in discussions of relevant material such as journal articles, media stories and environmental impact assessments. Students will also deliver an oral presentation to communicate their research on a current topic in environmental science.
intended learning outcomes: produce an in-depth analysis of current issues in environmental science;
apply scientific principles to evaluate evidence;
debate using constructive analysis issues involving environmental monitoring and decision making; and
appraise and critique scientific data analysis methodologies used to address an environmental challenge.

assessments.description: One essay of up to 2000 words. 2000 words
Contribution to discussions in tutorials, requiring evidence of preparation such as written notes or via other media
Leading a discussion in a tutorial throughout the semester, assessed on the quality of the presentation and the ability to encourage informed discussion
Oral presentation of up to 20 minutes towards the end of semester. 20 minutes
assessments.timing: Second half of the teaching period

Semester 2.Contact hours: 3 x one-hour tutorials each week (36 hours total)

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
